metadata.job_to_be_done: Prepare a comprehensive literature review focusing on methodologies, datasets, and performance benchmarks

extracted_sections.section_title: Prediction of Molecular Properties and Interactions
GNNs for Drug Discovery: An Integrated Pipeline

sub_section_analysis.refined_text: Molecule generation using GNNs applies deep generative models like VAEs and GANs to learn and create novel chemical structures optimized for drug-likeness and synthesizability.
GNNs are employed to predict molecular properties and drug-target interactions, improving accuracy through message passing networks and leveraging rich graph-based molecular representations.
The paper highlights widely used benchmark datasets like QM9, ZINC, and MoleculeNet, which support fair evaluation and comparison of GNN-based drug discovery models.
GNNs were applied to accelerate COVID-19 drug discovery by modeling protein-drug interactions, with insights into repurposing FDA-approved compounds for novel therapeutic pathways.
Dataset construction focused on integrating biological pathways, molecular graphs, and known COVID-19 targets, enabling supervised GNN training with structured biomedical data.
Evaluation metrics like AUC, accuracy, and enrichment factor demonstrated that GNN models outperformed traditional approaches in identifying high-affinity drug candidates.
An integrated pipeline combining GNN architectures with domain-specific preprocessing and post-analysis techniques is presented, aimed at practical decision support in early-stage drug discovery.
The decision support module aggregates predictions, confidence scores, and structural insights to help researchers prioritize lead compounds for further validation.
